dialogues.text: What'd she 'Live in Canada' or  something?  Why don't I remember this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you don't know about me I can  just about squeeze into the Grand  fucking Canyon.  Did you know I always  wanted to be a dancer in Vegas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Holden look at him.  Silent Bob busts a move with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunhh?  Bet you didn't know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just cell your fucking story so we can  get out of here and smoke this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Holden) So there's me an Amy, and we're all  inseparable, right?  Just big time in  love.  And then about four months in,  I ask about the ex-boyfriend.  Dumb  move, I know, but you know how it is -  you don't really want to know, but you  just have to... stupid guy bullshit.   Anyway she starts telling me all about  him - how they dated for years, lived  together, her mother likes me better,  blah, blah, blah - and I'm okay.  But  then she tells me that a couple times,  he brought other people to bed with  them - menage a tois, I believe it's  called.  Now this just blows my mind.   I mean, I'm not used to that sort of  thing, right?  I was raised Catholic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saint Shithead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silent Bob backhands him.  Jay raises his fist as if to  strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something. (to Holden) So I get weirded out, and just start  blasting her, right?  This is the only  way I can deal with it - by calling  her a slut, and telling her that she  was used - I mean, I'm out for blood I  want to hurt her - because I don't  know how to deal with what I'm  feeling.  And I'm like "What the fuck  is wrong with you?"  and she's telling  me that it was that time, in that  place, and she didn't do anything  wrong, so she's not gonna apologize.   So I tell her it's over, and I walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking a.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, idiot.  It was a mistake.  I  wasn't disgusted with her, I was  afraid.  At that moment, I felt small -  like I'd lacked experience, like I'd  never be on her level or never be  enough for her or something.   And what I didn't get was that she  didn't care.  She wasn't looking for  that guy anymore.  She was looking for  me.  But by the time I realized this,  it was too late, you know.  She'd  moved on, and all I had to show for it  was some foolish pride, which then  gave way to regret.  She was the girl,  I know that now.  But I pushed her  away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's silent Silent Bob lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I've spent every day since then  chasing Amy... (takes a drag from his smoke) So to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit there for a beat.  Jay pockets the rest of his  dime-bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough of this fucking melodrama.  My  advice - forget her, dude.  There's  one woman in the world.  One woman,  with many faces. (to Silent Bob) Get up, bitch (to Holden) We gotta book.  We're catching a bus  to Chi-town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business, yo.  How many more of those  phat envelopes do we got coming to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I don't know if the  book's going to be around much longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  Good.  I'll be glad as shit  when it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?  There's millions  of people out there that'd love to see  themselves in a comic book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I spend every fucking waking  hour with one of them.  But it ain't  like us at all - all slapsticky and  shit - running around like dicks,  saying... What's that shit you got me  saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snootchie-bootchies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Snootchie-bootchies'.  Who talks like  that?  That's baby-talk. (slaps his hand) It's a big world, g - but we're bound  to run into you again.  Until then -  keep your unit on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do, or do not - there is no ay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slaps him) Knock it off!  Get your fat ass moving  - we got a bus to catch. (under his breath) Jedi-bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exit Jay and Silent Bob.  Holden remains in the booth,  thinking.

dialogues.speaker: AN UNCOMFORTABLE SILENCE
dialogues.text: 1) Holden sits at his drawing table, tapping his pencil  up and down. 2)Alyssa sits in a club, getting talked at by some women. She's not present in the conversation. 3) Banky meets with Sloss at a restaurant Sloss shakes  the contracts at him, and Banky makes the "I know, I  know," face. 4) Holden stares at the picture Alyssa gave him. 5) Alyssa with her ear to the phone.  She hangs up,  angrily. 6) Holden sits in the park that he and Alyssa walked  through.  He's staring at Alyssa's yearbook picture.  He  closes the book and sighs.  Then, an idea hits him.  He  jumps up and dashes out of the park.

dialogues.speaker: INT STUDIO
dialogues.text: Banky and Alyssa sit on the couch.  Holden paces in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're wondering why I asked  you both here tonight, at the same  time, knowing that we have shit to  settle between us, separately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just figured you wanted to kill two  birds with one stone by telling her to  fuck off with me here so you didn't  have to go through the story again  later on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even if you let me videotape it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough! (they both look at him) I've been going through things, over  and over.  And I dissected it all, and  looked at it a thousand different  ways.  Banky - there's friction  between us for the first time in our  lives.  You hate me dating Alyssa and  you want me to sign off on this M-TV  thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How perceptive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa - you and I hit a wall, because  I don't know how to deal with... your  past, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a nice way of putting it.  I'd  have said the whole double-stuff  thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (right in his face) I'm only going to say it once: shut  up. (back to pacing) Now - I know I'm to blame one way or  the other on both accounts.  With you,  Alyssa - it's my fault because I feel  inadequate.  Because you've had so  much experience, had such a big life;  and my life's been pretty small in  comparison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't matter to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  I have to get through this. (beat) And with you Banky - I know why you're  having such a hard time with Alyssa,  and it's something that's been obvious  forever, but I guess I just didn't  acknowledge it. (takes a deep breath) You're in love with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (makes a face; beat) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're attracted to me.  Just as, in a  way, I'm attracted to you.  I mean, it  makes sense - we've been together so  long, we have so much in common...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up) Well, I've got to get home and catch  the last few minutes of 'Babylon 5',  so I'll be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holden grabs him, kisses him full on the lips, and pushes him back onto the couch Alyssa reacts.  Banky - wide-eyed and speechless - looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's something you're going to have to  deal with.  Bank.  You may very well  be gay, which explains your homophobia  and why you're so jealous of Alyssa,  and your sense of humor as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just 'cause a guy's got a predilection  coward dick jokes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bank.  Stop.  Deal with it.  You'll  feel much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a chair from the side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now - at this point, you may be asking  yourself the question that I've been  going over and over in my head for the  last few days: what does one have to  do with the other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa's face drops.  She subtly shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when I did some serious soul- searching, it came at me from out of  nowhere, and suddenly it all made  sense - a calm came over me.  I know  what we have to do.  And then you -  Bank, you Alyssa, and I - all of us...  can finally be... alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (again, under her breath) Please don't say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sits in the chair; takes a  long beat) We've all got to have sex together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is silent.  Holden Lights a cigarette.  Banky's  eyes nearly bug.   Alyssa's  head drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see?  That would take care  of everything.  Alyssa - I wouldn't  feel inadequate or too conservative  anymore.  I'll have done something on  par with all the experience you've  had.  And it'll be with you, which'll  make it that much more powerful.  And  Banky - you can cake that leap that  everyone else but you sees that you  should take.  And it'll be okay,  because it'll be with me - your best  friend for years.  We've been  everything to each other but  intimates.  And now, we'll have been  through that together too.  And it  won't have to be a total leap for you,  because a woman will be involved.  And  when it's over, all that aggression  you feel toward Alyssa will be gone.   Because you'll have shared in  something beautiful with the woman I  love.  It'll be cathartic.  A true  communion.  We have to do this.  For  me, for both of you... for all of our  sakes.  This will keep us together. (beat) What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banky stares forward, wide-eyed.  He leans back into the  couch and lets out a huge sigh.  Then shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holden smiles at his friend.  Then he looks at Alyssa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I need this.  You know it'll  help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa looks at him, sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holden reacts, shocked Banky lets out a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?  I... I thought you'd be into  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did?  What does that say about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you've... you've done... stuff...  like this.  This should be no big deal  for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want this. (lights her cigarette) You really don't want this.  Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need this.  This has to happen.  Why  can't you see that?  And how can you  not?  What does that say about me?   You can take it from two guys whose  names you can barely remember, but I  ask you to share an experience like it  - where it's about intimacy - and you  say no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inhales from her cigarette,  takes a beat) I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holden moves to her side of the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can.  I'll be there.  And when  it's over, we'll be the strongest  we've ever been because we got through  some nasty shit together.  And we'll  finally be on the same level together.   And then there'll be nothing we can't  accomplish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tear rolls down her cheek She looks at him, sadly, and  touches his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Holden. (trying to compose herself) That time is over for me.  I've been  there.  I've done it.  And I didn't  find what I was looking for in any of  it.  I found that in you - in us.   Doing this won't help you forget about  the things you're hung up on.  It'll  create more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it won't.  I thought about all of  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it will.  Maybe you'll see me  differently from then on - maybe  you'll despise me for going along with  it, once you're in the moment.  Maybe  I'll moan differently and then you'll  resent Banky, and become suspicious of  us.  Or you'll alienate him because of  it, and then grow to blame and hate me  for the deterioration of your  friendship.  Or what if- I sincerely  doubt it, but what if - I saw  something in Banky that I never saw  before, and fell in love with him and  left you.  I've been down roads like  this before; many times.  I know you  feel doing this will broaden your  horizons and give you experience.  But  I've had those experiences on my own.   I can't accompany you on your's.  I'm  past that now. (touches his face; stares to  cry) Or maybe I just love you too much.   And I feel hurt and let down that  you'd want to share me with anyone.   Because I never wanted to share you (holds it in; gets up) Regardless I can't be a part of this. (beat) Or you.  Not anymore (hugs him) I love you.  I always will.  Know  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She releases him, then slaps him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm not your fucking whore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa storms away, stopping briefly to look Banky up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's your's again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks our of the studio.  The door closes behind her. Banky and Holden stand there, silently.  Cut to black.

dialogues.speaker: INT COMIC BOOK SHOW
dialogues.text: It's ONE YEAR later.  We're at another show, not unlike  the one from the opening. A copy of 'Bluntman and Chronic' enters the frame.  The  cover reads 'The Death Chronic', complete with a  corresponding drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blast from the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banky sits at his own signing table.  Behind him hangs a  banner that reads 'BANKY EDWARDS - CREATOR Of BABY DAVE'. A small line is formed in front of him.  He talks with a  FAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how much it's going for  these days?  One ten.  You signing it  will push that up even higher,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you sell it, I want a kickback (starts signing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if this is true, but I  heard once that there was going to be  an animated series.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was going to be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off comic) You're looking at it.  No Chronic - no  cartoon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sucks man.  That would've been  awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what happened to you and  Holden McNeil?  You got into a fight  over the rights or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a little more involved than  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quit the biz.  I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys don't talk anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks OC) No.  Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banky locks eyes with someone OC.  His expression  softens. Holden leans against a wall on the far side of the room. He smiles at Banky.  Banky smiles back, and sort of nods. Holden holds up a copy of Banky's new solo comic.  He  points to it and gives a thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably shouldn't have killed off  Chronic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banky smiles to OC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess not.  Some doors just shouldn't  be opened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banky looks in another direction, OC.  He looks at Holden and points to it.   Holden looks in the same direction,  and then looks back at Banky and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need that guy, anyway.  You  do great stuff without him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banky looks at Holden for a beat.  Then he brings his  pointer fingers together,  mimicing Holden's 'shared  moment' gesture. Holden shrugs slightly, then crosses his fingers - as if  to say 'hopefully'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just carrying that guy,  anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banky sort of smiles at the OC Holden.  Then he offers  his own thumbs up - as to say 'good luck'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to fan, still looking OC) You're so right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holden smiles back, nods 'bye', and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, keep up the good work, man.   Love them dick jokes.  Love 'em.  See  ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fan Leaves, but Banky is watching Holden go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Bye. (shakes it off) Okay.  Who's next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa sits at a separate signing table, with a line in  front of her.  A WOMAN behind her.  Alyssa dashes off  signatures in the copies of her comic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to OC departing fan) Thanks for reading it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woman stands and rubs her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to get a soda.  You want  anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, thanks,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woman heads off.  Alyssa starts rummaging through her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not rooking up) Okay, who's next!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A comic book drops on the table in front of her.   It's a comic book called 'Chasing Amy'. She leafs through it, not looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... This isn't one of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa looks up sharply. Holden stands before her, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saved you one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) How've you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Really good.  Yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good (beat; off her own comic) New issue's selling like crazy, for  some reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's so good.  I really liked  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (off comic) I haven't even seen this yet.  Did it  just come out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A month ago.  I did a really small  run.  Self-financed.  Only about five  hundred issues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will I enjoy it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might.  It's familiar subject  matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa leafs through it.  Her eyes get somewhat misty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks Like a very personal story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finally had something personal to  say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other for a beat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go.  I don't want to hold  up the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I mean, it can get ugly.  I  just saw this nun in line call this  small child a cunt-rag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Read that, when you have a minute

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to hear your thoughts about  it.  If you get a chance, give me a  call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice seeing you again,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really nice to see you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks away.  A few steps away, he turns and waves  again.  She waves back.  And then he starts moving  through the thrall of fan-boys. The Woman returns with coffee.  She follows Alyssa's  gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm!  Oh.  Just some guy I knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches him go for another beat, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to line) Next (to Woman) So what do you want to do tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as they fall into conversation, the show goes on.
